required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of Xeloda (Capecitabine) in Combination With Oxaliplatin in Patients With Metastatic Colorectal Cancer.
clinical_study.official_title: An Open-label Study to Assess the Pharmacokinetic Interaction Between Xeloda and Oxaliplatin in Patients With Metastatic Colorectal Cancer.

brief_summary.textblock: This single arm study will investigate possible pharmacokinetic interactions between Xeloda and oxaliplatin, and assess whether the pharmacokinetics of Xeloda and/or oxaliplatin is influenced by the addition of Avastin. All subjects will provide samples for pharmacokinetic analysis during the first 3 cycles of treatment. In cycles 1 and 2 patients will receive a treatment regimen containing Xeloda (1000mg/m2 bid) and oxaliplatin (130mg/m2 iv) and in cycle 3 Avastin (7.5mg/kg iv) will be added to the regimen. The anticipated time on study treatment is 3-12 months, and the target sample size is <100 individuals.

primary_outcome.measure: Area Under The Plasma Concentration-Time Curve From Zero To Infinity (AUC0-Inf) of 5'-Deoxy-5-fluorouridine 5'-(DFUR)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose, 0.5, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 8, 10, and 12 hours post the dose.
primary_outcome.description: AUC0-infinity represents the area under the concentration-time curve of the analyte (5'-DFUR) in plasma over the time interval from 0 extrapolated to infinity. The analyte 5'-DFUR, the direct precursor of 5-fluorouracil (5-FU), is considered to be the most important metabolite of capecitabine in plasma. The unit of measure was nanograms per millilitre per hour (ng/mL * hr).

primary_outcome.time_frame: Predose , 0.5, 1, 1.5, 2, 2.5, 3, 4, 6, 8, 12, 24, 48 and 72 hours from the beginning of the 2 hour oxaliplatin infusion on Days 2 to 5 of Cycle 1, and Days 1 to 4 for Cycle 2 and 3.
primary_outcome.description: AUC0-infinity represents the area under the concentration-time curve of the analyte (free platinum) in plasma over the time interval from 0 extrapolated to infinity. AUC0-inf for free platinum was calculated for each participant from the concentration-data obtained on Days 2 to 5 of Cycle 1, and Days 1 to 4 for Cycle 2 and 3. Free platinum is not bound to plasma proteins and is considered to be the most clinically significant measure of pharmacological and toxicological activity.

secondary_outcome.measure: AUC (0-infinity) of Capecitabine and Its Metabolites (5'-DFCR, 5-FU, and FBAL)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose, 0.5, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 8, 10, and 12 hours post the dose
secondary_outcome.description: AUC0-infinity represents the area under the concentration-time curve of the analytes (5'-DFCR, 5-FU, and FBAL) in plasma over the time interval from 0 extrapolated to infinity. After oral administration, capecitabine is first metabolized in the liver to 5'-deoxy-5-fluorocytidine (5'-DFCR), which is then converted to 5'-DFUR, and then catalytically activated to 5-FU.

secondary_outcome.measure: AUC0-last of Capecitabine and Its Metabolites (5'-DFUR, 5'-DFCR, 5 FU, and FBAL)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose, 0.5, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 8, 10, and 12 hours post the dose
secondary_outcome.description: Area under the plasma concentration-time curve from time zero to the time of the last measurable plasma concentration time point of capecitabine and its metabolites (5'-DFUR, 5'-DFCR, 5 FU, and FBAL).

secondary_outcome.measure: Maximum Plasma Concentration (Cmax) of Capecitabine and Its Metabolites (5'-DFUR, 5'-DFCR, 5 FU, and FBAL)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose, 0.5, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 8, 10, and 12 hours post the dose
secondary_outcome.description: Cmax is defined as maximum observed analyte concentration of capecitabine and its metabolites (5'-DFUR, 5'-DFCR, 5 FU, and FBAL)

secondary_outcome.measure: Elimination Half-life Period (t1/2 Beta) of Capecitabine and Its Metabolites (5'-DFUR , 5'-DFCR, 5 FU, and FBAL)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose, 0.5, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 8, 10, and 12 hours post the dose
secondary_outcome.description: t1/2 Beta is the time measured for the plasma concentration to decrease by 1 half to its original concentration of capecitabine and its metabolites (5'-DFUR , 5'-DFCR, 5 FU, and FBAL)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose, and 0.5, 1, 1.5, 2, 2.5, 3, 4, 6, 8, 12, 24, 48 and 72 hours from the beginning of the two hour oxaliplatin infusion on Days 2 to 5 of Cycle 1, and Days 1 to 4 for Cycle 2 and 3
secondary_outcome.description: AUC0-infinity represents the area under the concentration-time curve of the analyte (total platinum) in plasma over the time interval from 0 extrapolated to infinity.

secondary_outcome.measure: AUC0-last of Total And Free Platinum
secondary_outcome.time_frame: pre-dose, and 0.5, 1, 1.5, 2, 2.5, 3, 4, 6, 8, 12, 24, 48 and 72 hours from the beginning of the two hour oxaliplatin infusion on Days 2 to 5 of Cycle 1, and Days 1 to 4 for Cycle 2 and 3.
secondary_outcome.description: Area under the plasma concentration-time curve from time zero to the time of the last measurable plasma concentration time point of Total And Free Platinum.

secondary_outcome.measure: Cmax of Total And Free Platinum
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose, and 0.5, 1, 1.5, 2, 2.5, 3, 4, 6, 8, 12, 24, 48 and 72 hours from the beginning of the two hour oxaliplatin infusion on Days 2 to 5 of Cycle 1, and Days 1 to 4 for Cycle 2 and 3.
secondary_outcome.description: Cmax is defined as maximum observed analyte concentration of Total And Free Platinum.

secondary_outcome.measure: T1/2 Beta of Total And Free Platinum
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose, and 0.5, 1, 1.5, 2, 2.5, 3, 4, 6, 8, 12, 24, 48 and 72 hours from the beginning of the two hour oxaliplatin infusion on Days 2 to 5 of Cycle 1, and Days 1 to 4 for Cycle 2 and 3
secondary_outcome.description: T1/2 beta is the time measured for the plasma concentration to decrease by 1 half to its original concentration of total and free platinum.

secondary_outcome.measure: Volume of Distribution at Steady State (VSS) of Total And Free Platinum
secondary_outcome.description: VSS is defined as the theoretical volume in which the total amount of drug would need to be uniformly distributed to produce the desired blood concentration of a drug. Steady state volume of distribution (Vss) is the apparent volume of distribution at steady-state.

secondary_outcome.measure: Clearance of Total And Free Platinum
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose, and 0.5, 1, 1.5, 2, 2.5, 3, 4, 6, 8, 12, 24, 48 and 72 hours from the beginning of the two hour oxaliplatin infusion on Days 2 to 5 of Cycle 1, and Days 1 to 4 for Cycle 2 and 3
secondary_outcome.description: CL is a calculation of the rate at which a drug is removed from the body via renal, hepatic and other clearance pathways, expressed as volume (milliliters) per unit of time (hour).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number Of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Approximately 3 Years (up to 28 days after the last intake of study medication)
secondary_outcome.description: An adverse event is defined as any untoward medical occurrence in a participant or clinical investigation participant administered a pharmaceutical product. This includes any unfavorable and unintended sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding), symptom, or disease temporally associated with the use of a medicinal product, whether or not considered related to the medicinal product. Pre-existing conditions which worsened during the study were also to be reported as AEs.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 28 days after last chemotherapy administration
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with marked laboratory abnormalities (hematology, coagulation, liver function, renal function, protein, electrolytes, miscellaneous).

participant_flow.recruitment_details: A total of 36 participants were enrolled in this study at three sites in Canada between 8 August 2005 and 24 April 2008.

group.title: Capecitabine+ Oxaliplatin+ Bevacizumab
group.description: In Cycle 1, participants received a single oral dose of capecitabine 1000 milligrams per meter square (mg/m^2 on Day 1 followed by 2-hour intravenous (IV) infusion of oxaliplatin 130 mg/m^2 on Day 2 followed by oral dosing of capecitabine 1000 mg/m^2 twice-daily (BID) from Day 5 to Day 14 . In Cycle 2, participants received IV infusion of oxaliplatin 130 mg//m^2 over 2 hours on Day 1 along with capecitabine 1000 mg/m^2 orally BID until Day 14. In Cycle 3, participants received IV infusion of bevacizumab 7.5 mg/kg over 90 minutes on Day 1 at the same time as oxaliplatin 130 mg//m^2 was administered as an IV infusion over 2 hours (Day 1 every 3 weeks) along with capecitabine1000 mg//m^2 orally BID until Day 14. Treatment with the Cycle 3 dosing regimen continued for a further 13 cycles (i.e. Cycle 16) or until progressive disease or unacceptable toxicity or until the participant withdrew consent

group.title: Capecitabine+ Oxaliplatin+ Bevacizumab
group.description: In Cycle 1, participants received a single oral dose of capecitabine 1000 milligrams per meter square (mg/m^2 on Day 1 followed by 2-hour intravenous (IV) infusion of oxaliplatin 130 mg/m^2 on Day 2 followed by oral dosing of capecitabine 1000 mg/m^2 twice-daily (BID) from Day 5 to Day 14 . In Cycle 2, participants received IV infusion of oxaliplatin 130 mg//m^2 over 2 hours on Day 1 along with capecitabine 1000 mg/m^2 orally BID until Day 14. In Cycle 3, participants received IV infusion of bevacizumab 7.5 mg/kg over 90 minutes on Day 1 at the same time as oxaliplatin 130 mg//m^2 was administered as an IV infusion over 2 hours (Day 1 every 3 weeks) along with capecitabine1000 mg//m^2 orally BID until Day 14. Treatment with the Cycle 3 dosing regimen continued for a further 13 cycles (i.e. Cycle 16) or until progressive disease or unacceptable toxicity or until the participant withdrew consent

outcome.title: Area Under The Plasma Concentration-Time Curve From Zero To Infinity (AUC0–Inf) of 5’-Deoxy-5-fluorouridine 5’-(DFUR)
outcome.description: AUC0-infinity represents the area under the concentration-time curve of the analyte (5’-DFUR) in plasma over the time interval from 0 extrapolated to infinity. The analyte 5’-DFUR, the direct precursor of 5-fluorouracil (5-FU), is considered to be the most important metabolite of capecitabine in plasma. The unit of measure was nanograms per millilitre per hour (ng/mL * hr).
outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose, 0.5, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 8, 10, and 12 hours post the dose.
outcome.population: All patients for whom observations contributing to the relevant assessments were available, who did not experience dose reductions, and for whom dosing was as required by the protocol were included in the corresponding analysis.

group.title: Capecitabine+ Oxaliplatin+ Bevacizumab
group.description: In Cycle 1, participants received a single oral dose of capecitabine 1000 milligrams per meter square (mg/m^2 on Day 1 followed by 2-hour intravenous (IV) infusion of oxaliplatin 130 mg/m^2 on Day 2 followed by oral dosing of capecitabine 1000 mg/m^2 twice-daily (BID) from Day 5 to Day 14 . In Cycle 2, participants received IV infusion of oxaliplatin 130 mg//m^2 over 2 hours on Day 1 along with capecitabine 1000 mg/m^2 orally BID until Day 14. In Cycle 3, participants received IV infusion of bevacizumab 7.5 mg/kg over 90 minutes on Day 1 at the same time as oxaliplatin 130 mg//m^2 was administered as an IV infusion over 2 hours (Day 1 every 3 weeks) along with capecitabine1000 mg//m^2 orally BID until Day 14. Treatment with the Cycle 3 dosing regimen continued for a further 13 cycles (i.e. Cycle 16) or until progressive disease or unacceptable toxicity or until the participant withdrew consent

group.description: In Cycle 1, participants received a single oral dose of capecitabine 1000 milligrams per meter square (mg/m^2 on Day 1 followed by 2-hour intravenous (IV) infusion of oxaliplatin 130 mg/m^2 on Day 2 followed by oral dosing of capecitabine 1000 mg/m^2 twice-daily (BID) from Day 5 to Day 14 . In Cycle 2, participants received IV infusion of oxaliplatin 130 mg//m^2 over 2 hours on Day 1 along with capecitabine 1000 mg/m^2 orally BID until Day 14. In Cycle 3, participants received IV infusion of bevacizumab 7.5 mg/kg over 90 minutes on Day 1 at the same time as oxaliplatin 130 mg//m^2 was administered as an IV infusion over 2 hours (Day 1 every 3 weeks) along with capecitabine1000 mg//m^2 orally BID until Day 14. Treatment with the Cycle 3 dosing regimen continued for a further 13 cycles (i.e. Cycle 16) or until progressive disease or unacceptable toxicity or until the participant withdrew consent

measure.title: AUC0-last of Total And Free Platinum
measure.description: Area under the plasma concentration-time curve from time zero to the time of the last measurable plasma concentration time point of Total And Free Platinum.
measure.population: All patients for whom observations contributing to the relevant assessments were available, who did not experience dose reductions, and for whom dosing was as required by the protocol were included in the corresponding analysis.

outcome.title: Cmax of Total And Free Platinum
outcome.description: Cmax is defined as maximum observed analyte concentration of Total And Free Platinum.
outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose, and 0.5, 1, 1.5, 2, 2.5, 3, 4, 6, 8, 12, 24, 48 and 72 hours from the beginning of the two hour oxaliplatin infusion on Days 2 to 5 of Cycle 1, and Days 1 to 4 for Cycle 2 and 3.
outcome.population: All patients for whom observations contributing to the relevant assessments were available, who did not experience dose reductions, and for whom dosing was as required by the protocol were included in the corresponding analysis.

In Cycle 2, participants received IV infusion of oxaliplatin 130 mg//m^2 over 2 hours on Day 1 along with capecitabine 1000 mg/m^2 orally BID until Day 14. In Cycle 3, participants received IV infusion of bevacizumab 7.5 mg/kg over 90 minutes on Day 1 at the same time as oxaliplatin 130 mg//m^2 was administered as an IV infusion over 2 hours (Day 1 every 3 weeks) along with capecitabine1000 mg//m^2 orally BID until Day 14. Treatment with the Cycle 3 dosing regimen continued for a further 13 cycles (i.e. Cycle 16) or until progressive disease or unacceptable toxicity or until the participant withdrew consent

measure.title: Cmax of Total And Free Platinum
measure.description: Cmax is defined as maximum observed analyte concentration of Total And Free Platinum.
measure.population: All patients for whom observations contributing to the relevant assessments were available, who did not experience dose reductions, and for whom dosing was as required by the protocol were included in the corresponding analysis.

outcome.title: T1/2 Beta of Total And Free Platinum
outcome.description: T1/2 beta is the time measured for the plasma concentration to decrease by 1 half to its original concentration of total and free platinum.
outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose, and 0.5, 1, 1.5, 2, 2.5, 3, 4, 6, 8, 12, 24, 48 and 72 hours from the beginning of the two hour oxaliplatin infusion on Days 2 to 5 of Cycle 1, and Days 1 to 4 for Cycle 2 and 3
outcome.population: All patients for whom observations contributing to the relevant assessments were available, who did not experience dose reductions, and for whom dosing was as required by the protocol were included in the corresponding analysis.

group.title: Capecitabine+ Oxaliplatin+ Bevacizumab
group.description: In Cycle 1, participants received a single oral dose of capecitabine 1000 milligrams per meter square (mg/m^2 on Day 1 followed by 2-hour intravenous (IV) infusion of oxaliplatin 130 mg/m^2 on Day 2 followed by oral dosing of capecitabine 1000 mg/m^2 twice-daily (BID) from Day 5 to Day 14 . In Cycle 2, participants received IV infusion of oxaliplatin 130 mg//m^2 over 2 hours on Day 1 along with capecitabine 1000 mg/m^2 orally BID until Day 14. In Cycle 3, participants received IV infusion of bevacizumab 7.5 mg/kg over 90 minutes on Day 1 at the same time as oxaliplatin 130 mg//m^2 was administered as an IV infusion over 2 hours (Day 1 every 3 weeks) along with capecitabine1000 mg//m^2 orally BID until Day 14. measure.title: T1/2 Beta of Total And Free Platinum
measure.description: T1/2 beta is the time measured for the plasma concentration to decrease by 1 half to its original concentration of total and free platinum.
measure.population: All patients for whom observations contributing to the relevant assessments were available, who did not experience dose reductions, and for whom dosing was as required by the protocol were included in the corresponding analysis.

outcome.title: Volume of Distribution at Steady State (VSS) of Total And Free Platinum
outcome.description: VSS is defined as the theoretical volume in which the total amount of drug would need to be uniformly distributed to produce the desired blood concentration of a drug. Steady state volume of distribution (Vss) is the apparent volume of distribution at steady-state.
outcome.population: All patients for whom observations contributing to the relevant assessments were available, who did not experience dose reductions, and for whom dosing was as required by the protocol were included in the corresponding analysis.

group.title: Capecitabine+ Oxaliplatin+ Bevacizumab
group.description: In Cycle 1, participants received a single oral dose of capecitabine 1000 milligrams per meter square (mg/m^2 on Day 1 followed by 2-hour intravenous (IV) infusion of oxaliplatin 130 mg/m^2 on Day 2 followed by oral dosing of capecitabine 1000 mg/m^2 twice-daily (BID) from Day 5 to Day 14 . In Cycle 2, participants received IV infusion of oxaliplatin 130 mg//m^2 over 2 hours on Day 1 along with capecitabine 1000 mg/m^2 orally BID until Day 14. In Cycle 3, participants received IV infusion of bevacizumab 7.5 mg/kg over 90 minutes on Day 1 at the same time as oxaliplatin 130 mg//m^2 was administered as an IV infusion over 2 hours (Day 1 every 3 weeks) along with capecitabine1000 mg//m^2 orally BID until Day 14. Treatment with the Cycle 3 dosing regimen continued for a further 13 cycles (i.e. Cycle 16) or until progressive disease or unacceptable toxicity or until the participant withdrew consent

measure.title: Volume of Distribution at Steady State (VSS) of Total And Free Platinum
measure.description: VSS is defined as the theoretical volume in which the total amount of drug would need to be uniformly distributed to produce the desired blood concentration of a drug. Steady state volume of distribution (Vss) is the apparent volume of distribution at steady-state.
measure.population: All patients for whom observations contributing to the relevant assessments were available, who did not experience dose reductions, and for whom dosing was as required by the protocol were included in the corresponding analysis.

outcome.title: Clearance of Total And Free Platinum
outcome.description: CL is a calculation of the rate at which a drug is removed from the body via renal, hepatic and other clearance pathways, expressed as volume (milliliters) per unit of time (hour).
outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose, and 0.5, 1, 1.5, 2, 2.5, 3, 4, 6, 8, 12, 24, 48 and 72 hours from the beginning of the two hour oxaliplatin infusion on Days 2 to 5 of Cycle 1, and Days 1 to 4 for Cycle 2 and 3
outcome.population: All patients for whom observations contributing to the relevant assessments were available, who did not experience dose reductions, and for whom dosing was as required by the protocol were included in the corresponding analysis.

group.title: Capecitabine+ Oxaliplatin+ Bevacizumab
group.description: In Cycle 1, participants received a single oral dose of capecitabine 1000 milligrams per meter square (mg/m^2 on Day 1 followed by 2-hour intravenous (IV) infusion of oxaliplatin 130 mg/m^2 on Day 2 followed by oral dosing of capecitabine 1000 mg/m^2 twice-daily (BID) from Day 5 to Day 14 . In Cycle 2, participants received IV infusion of oxaliplatin 130 mg//m^2 over 2 hours on Day 1 along with capecitabine 1000 mg/m^2 orally BID until Day 14. In Cycle 3, participants received IV infusion of bevacizumab 7.5 mg/kg over 90 minutes on Day 1 at the same time as oxaliplatin 130 mg//m^2 was administered as an IV infusion over 2 hours (Day 1 every 3 weeks) along with capecitabine1000 mg//m^2 orally BID until Day 14. Treatment with the Cycle 3 dosing regimen continued for a further 13 cycles (i.e. Cycle 16) or until progressive disease or unacceptable toxicity or until the participant withdrew consent

measure.title: Clearance of Total And Free Platinum

measure.population: All patients for whom observations contributing to the relevant assessments were available, who did not experience dose reductions, and for whom dosing was as required by the protocol were included in the corresponding analysis.

outcome.title: Number Of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs)
outcome.description: An adverse event is defined as any untoward medical occurrence in a participant or clinical investigation participant administered a pharmaceutical product. This includes any unfavorable and unintended sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding), symptom, or disease temporally associated with the use of a medicinal product, whether or not considered related to the medicinal product. Pre-existing conditions which worsened during the study were also to be reported as AEs.
outcome.time_frame: Approximately 3 Years (up to 28 days after the last intake of study medication)
outcome.population: All 36 participants who received at least one dose of capecitabine.

group.title: Capecitabine+ Oxaliplatin+ Bevacizumab
group.description: In Cycle 1, participants received a single oral dose of capecitabine 1000 milligrams per meter square (mg/m^2 on Day 1 followed by 2-hour intravenous (IV) infusion of oxaliplatin 130 mg/m^2 on Day 2 followed by oral dosing of capecitabine 1000 mg/m^2 twice-daily (BID) from Day 5 to Day 14 . In Cycle 2, participants received IV infusion of oxaliplatin 130 mg//m^2 over 2 hours on Day 1 along with capecitabine 1000 mg/m^2 orally BID until Day 14. In Cycle 3, participants received IV infusion of bevacizumab 7.5 mg/kg over 90 minutes on Day 1 at the same time as oxaliplatin 130 mg//m^2 was administered as an IV infusion over 2 hours (Day 1 every 3 weeks) along with capecitabine1000 mg//m^2 orally BID until Day 14. Treatment with the Cycle 3 dosing regimen continued for a further 13 cycles (i.e. Cycle 16) or until progressive disease or unacceptable toxicity or until the participant withdrew consent

measure.title: Number Of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs)
measure.description: An adverse event is defined as any untoward medical occurrence in a participant or clinical investigation participant administered a pharmaceutical product. This includes any unfavorable and unintended sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding), symptom, or disease temporally associated with the use of a medicinal product, whether or not considered related to the medicinal product. Pre-existing conditions which worsened during the study were also to be reported as AEs.
measure.population: All 36 participants who received at least one dose of capecitabine.

outcome.title: Marked Laboratory Abnormalities
outcome.description: Number of participants with marked laboratory abnormalities (hematology, coagulation, liver function, renal function, protein, electrolytes, miscellaneous).
outcome.time_frame: Up to 28 days after last chemotherapy administration
outcome.population: All 36 participants who received at least one dose of capecitabine.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The Study being conducted under this Agreement is part of the Overall Study. Investigator is free to publish in reputable journals or to present at professional conferences the results of the Study, but only after the first publication or presentation that involves the Overall Study. The Sponsor may request that Confidential Information be deleted and/or the publication be postponed in order to protect the Sponsor's intellectual property rights.
